intro: Scutellaria veronicifolia var. patentipilosa, commonly known as the broad-leaved skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant features lanceolate to ovate leaves with a soft, velvety texture and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
